metadata.name: Extreme Ways #6
metadata.description:
« Extreme ways are back again
Extreme places I didn't know
I broke everything new again
Everything that I'd owned
I threw it out the windows, came along
Extreme ways I know move apart The colors of my sea
Perfect color me… »
Song/Lyrics by Moby

All pieces are broken again and again…

Controls
Extreme ways contains some interactivity if you wish to explore.
Since this artwork is complex it takes time to draw, be patient. 

Press h in live mode to list the possibilities and see tips for interactivity usage.
Key ’s’  : Save an image of the output at the current resolution
Key 1-9 : Change resolution
Key ‘c’ : Change colors
Key ‘m’ : Change main style
Key ‘d’ : Change drawing style
…
 

Pricing
Proposed as a Dutch Auction 11-9-7-5 tez with a step every 10 minutes.


Features
Main features are listed : Main style, drawing style, etc…
I do not think rarity will be a good indicator of the quality of the output.
Trust your taste and buy on the secondary what you like…
Lots of parameters are used internally to ensure a large variety in the outputs.

Copyright (c) 2022 TidallyDisruptedStar. Twitter: @TidallyD.
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Colored Rectangles #59
metadata.description: Algorithmic color, p5.js

metadata.name: VOYAGERS #132
metadata.description:
Generative animated painting made from looping gestures in a virtual void.

Voyagers is an exploration of automated gestures and screenspace layering effects. Each brush stroke sweeps through the canvas leaving a trail of color that either disappears or mixes with adjacent colors. The image slowly builds up to achieve an equilibrium between the rhythm of the gestures and the interaction of color values. These colors are quantized and dithered to produce chunky, textured, blocks of light that reify the materiality of the screen and the pixel. Two aspect ratios are possible, each with its own material relationship to screen-based work, 1:1 and 4:3 (vertical).

Press 's' to save looping animated GIF (live mode only).
Press 'p' to pause the animation.
Press 'c' to capture a single frame.
Made with P5.js and GLSL. By @galoandstuff.

metadata.name: rive #218
metadata.description:
Starting with a repeatable system of colors and/or triangles typically seen in geometric abstraction, rive employs generative art to break/split/rive those patterns–and the comfort we find in them–in slight, seemingly unintentional ways.  With each subsequent split, our comfort fades as the artwork is shredded into barely recognizable fragments of a once carefully orchestrated pattern.

Not all rivings are created equal; some are subtle and barely visible while others are acute and violent.  

What holds it together is what breaks it apart.  

created using triangles and p5js

rive
abstractment, 2022

___________________________

Functionality:
Press ‘p’ to save as a png.
Press 0-9 to render at varying degrees of quality. 0 to 9 (highest quality, ~15k x ~15k, depending on the dimensions).  The window background will change colors when completed rendering.
Press ⬆️ (arrow up) to increase pixel density by 0.5.
Press ⬇️ (arrow down) to decrease pixel density by 0.5.

metadata.name: Time Intertwined #34
metadata.description:
by Daeinc
May 2022

An exploration into time and motion. Two linear timelines - structural and surficial - are intertwined. By weaving these timelines at different points in time, almost infinite variations can be made. The changing relationship between the two creates dynamic and unique compositions and challenges the visual perception.

## Guide:
- Please note that the animation responds to window aspect ratio. This is an intentional behavior as part of interactivity. It reproduces the same outcome at the same ratio. 
- To export image at specific size, use URL parameters as below.
- See browser console for more info.
- Tested on MacOS 12.3.1 with Chrome 101.0

## Keyboard Interaction:
- [0] for exhibit. it switches to a different mode every 3 loops.
- [s] to export PNG image. use URL params for dimensions.
- [spacebar] to play/pause animation
- [1 ~ 5] for different play modes
- [1]: all 
- [2]: surficial 
- [3]: constant 
- [4]: all-constant
- [5]: structural
- [h] to toggle hi-DPI mode. (for retina display)

## URL Parameters:
- add parameters separated by ampersand to the URL ex. https://.../?fxhash=...&mode=exhibit&w=800&st=5.3
- [mode]: play mode (exhibit, all, surficial, constant, all-constant, structural)
- [w]: width. (ex. w=1200)
- [h]: height. (ex. h=600)
- [st]: structural timecode. up to 2 decimals (ex. st=4.31)
- [su]: surficial timecode. up to 2 decimals (ex. su=15.04)
- [co]: constant offset. up to 2 decimals (ex. co=7.4)
- [pr]: pixel ratio. set it to 2 (or press [h]) for hi-DPI screens.

## License
CC-BY-NC 4.0
Please refer to the included LICENSE.md for license information.
Libraries used: p5, canvas-sketch, canvas-sketch-util, keyframes, easing equations from easings.net

metadata.name: arawa #51
metadata.description:
‘arawa’ is a gift to holders of Deconstructions, Refractions and Mina as a kind thank you for your support!


Probabilities;

- 7 compositions with variations.

- 2 different particle starting placements.

- 7 different fixed color palettes & an algorithmic color palette generator.

- 2 different painting types.

- Different painting densities.

- Several starting styles (wavy or straight).

In live mode, press ‘s’ to save as PNG (2000 x 1125 px)


Made with p5.js

Ilgın İçözü, May 2022
@distcollective

metadata.name: Haystack in a Needle #27
metadata.description:
Things are always where they are supposed to be. But sometimes what we are looking for is not where we are looking for. If we really want to find something, we need to look for it in the right place.

Things will be found, but only when we are truly ready to find them.

* * *

Press S to save as PNG.

Made by: yenren / twitter.com/yenrenART
Made with: JavaScript + HTML Canvas
License: LICENSE.txt

metadata.name: 侍 (SAMURAI) #38
metadata.description:
Limited edition, print-like series of SAMURAI warriors rendered in different muted colors for the #TezosJaponica event.

Resolution in live mode should be high enough to allow for high quality prints at home.

Made possible by PureSpider's amazing template.

metadata.name: Tympanic #54
metadata.description:
Tympanic is a companion piece to Euphonic [https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/10982] and is released as a free gift to all collectors of Euphonic.

Like Euphonic, this piece attempts to play with the idea of interference and emergent patterns, but this time does so by using pixelation instead of Moire. In this way, where Euphonic was about emergent melodies, Tympanic is about emergent rhythms.

This is built in WebGL 2 and so doesn't work in Safari 14 and below. All latest browsers will work as expected.

Licensing: BY-NC-ND see license.md for details.

metadata.name: QUE DU BRUIT, VARIATION NOIRE #5
metadata.description:
Pour créer cette proposition, j'ai utilisé du bruit VHS, en jouant avec la saturation et en supprimant certaines données pour créer des zones de transparence.

Le bruit réfère à une poétique politique. Le vacarme est permanent. L'ordre et le silence, improbable.

J'ai retravaillé les couches pour créer cette suite de variations noires.

*

J'utilise le code de PureSpider pour travailler les couches d'images.
